data.event: Founded in 1636, it is the oldest county in Maine and one of the oldest in the United States.

event.title: asserted territorial claims over what is now

data.event: In the 1650s the nearby Massachusetts Bay Colony asserted territorial claims over what is now southern Maine, and by 1658 had completely absorbed what is now southwestern Maine into York County, Massachusetts.

In the 1650s the nearby Massachusetts Bay Colony asserted territorial claims over what is now southern Maine, and by 1658 had completely absorbed what is now southwestern Maine into York County, Massachusetts.

event.title: a purchase of land in York County is in 1668

data.event: The first known and recorded deed for a purchase of land in York County is in 1668, when Francis Small traded goods with the Newichewannock tribe of this area.
Small escaped after watching his house in what is now Cornish, Maine, burn to the ground.

event.title: now as the five Ossipee towns, the tract included

data.event: Known now as the five Ossipee towns, the tract included all of Limington, Limerick, Cornish (formerly named Francisborough), Newfield and Parsonsfield.
